titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I left Edinburgh by the 10 a.m. express

. Willie Murray turned up at the station, & talked to me for 20 minutes before the train started. The journey was uneventful. I drove in a sorrowful hansom to Garland's hotel, and then made my way to the Athenaeum, where I dined. The Bishop of Carlisle came and sate at my table â€“ a de–appetising companion!
